Anti-Aliasing Quality:
Off because the aliasing really is not that bad, but it is still quite visible.
SMAA 1x handles the spatial aliasing quite well, so you can go to that if you wish
TAA handles spatial and temporal well, but there is clear ghosting and the accumulation is not that fast, so you can see things brighten after you finish moving
Texture Quality:
Does not matter, setting appears to be texture streaming related, not direcet texture quality.
From Low to Can it Run Crysis?, the VRAM utilization, according to Task Manager (yes it can report that) was the same at around 6 GB, the limit for the card
Shadows Quality: Low and Medium look no different
Physics Quality: An exploding barrel looks different on Low than Can it Run Crysis? but Low still looks pretty good. Perhaps other examples are influenced more, but as this is, I would have no issue whatsoever with Low.
Shaders Quality:
Low looks fine, but is definitely not as good as High+

The only difference I spotted was with the filtering of shadows, so at Low-Medium the transition at the edge of shadows was not as smooth than at High+
Ray Tracing Quality:
Off because you do not really need it.
If you want it on, Performance does not look that bad, at least for reflections
Vegetation:
The setting appears to control draw distance for vegetation (foliage objects so rocks are counted too). At Low the distance is still pretty good, but you can see things dot/dissolve in.
Medium is better, and High is better still, but Low looks fine

Anti-Aliasing Quality:
SMAA 2Tx is defintiely the best, handles both spatial and temporal aliasing very well
SMAA 1Tx handles temporal better than TAA (less ghosting, fastering accumulation), but TAA handles spatial aliasing better.
Shadows Quality: High, Very High, Can it Run Crysis? all look the same. There is a pulsing to the shadows that makes little sense to be there (the sun does not move). The appearance of this pulsing distinguishes High+ from Low and Medium, but nothing distinguishes between High, Very High and Can it Run Crysis?, at least not at the area I am looking (near the GPS blocker in Contact)
Physics Quality: Do not feel like investigating Maximum because of the amount of checkpoint reloading that will be necessary to compare explosions
Shaders Quality:
High+ all look the same for the example I found of the rifle shadow
Potentially other examples could show other differences, but I am happy I found one thing that was clearly impacted
Ray Tracing Quality:
Can It Run Crysis? is the maximum because each level actually does have a different visual quality to it.
Performance has noise to the reflections, like data is missing
High has less noise than Performance
Very High has less of the Performance noise than High but also some noise that looks like lossy image compression
Can it Run Crysis? has noise that looks like lossy image compression and very little of the missing data noise
Vegetation:
Cannot spot difference between Very High and Can It Run Crysis?
Between High and Very High I was able to spot additional objects with Very High, but they are at such a distance that it really doesn't matter much. (I would not feel bad about going to High if it helps with performance.)
